item.title: Movement speed
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Those events are used for waiting for the player to reach the destination(And 500ms is wrong time for checking that btw) and have nothing to do with walking speed. If you want to speed up movement you’d have to do edits to the client itself because it expects movement to happen once per 600ms, if you speed up the movement you will see twitching and laggy movement.

Read full topic

item.title: Movement speed
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

How to change the movement speed has never been solved. Walking speed must be server-side as an event.

public WalkToPointEvent(Player owner, Point location, int radius, boolean stop) { super(owner, 500); this.location = location; this.radius = radius; this.stop = stop;

public WalkToObjectEvent(Player owner, GameObject object, boolean stop) { super(owner, 601); this.object = object; this.stop = stop;

public WalkToMobEvent(Player owner, Mob affectedMob, int radius) { super(owner, 600); this.affectedMob = affectedMob; this.radius = radius;

public WalkMobToMobEvent(Mob owner, Mob affectedMob, int radius) { super(null, 500);

Come to think of it, walk speed does seem to be 500ms per tile. Two tiles per second. Can’t test this yet, still at work.

Read full topic
